subject: Medicine
title: The History of Placebos
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The History of Placebos.

hook.text: The word placebo comes from Latin meaning I shall please.

buildup.text: For centuries, doctors gave harmless treatments to comfort patients.

discovery.text: In 1955, Henry Beecher proved placebos had measurable effects.

twist.text: He studied wounded soldiers who improved on saline injections.

climax.text: His paper changed how all medical research is done today.

punchline.text: Saline on a battlefield changed medicine.

quiz.question: Who published the landmark paper on the placebo effect in 1955?
